intro: Cuphea racemosa f. polysperma, commonly known as the many-seeded cuphea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, with branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its unique feature is the production of multiple seeds per flower, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for warm climates.
